message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of negatively birefringent crystals on polarized light indicates gout. Indomethacin is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) commonly used to treat gout and relieve pain. Probenecid, colchicine, and febuxostat are also used in the treatment of gout, but their main mechanisms of action differ from indomethacin and they are not the best choice for treating the patient’s pain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and the presence of negatively birefringent crystals on arthrocentesis suggest gout. Among the options, indomethacin is the best choice for treating gout pain. Probenecid and febuxostat are used for long-term management of gout, while colchicine is used for gout flares but can cause gastrointestinal side effects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The negatively birefringent crystals on polarized light observed in the arthrocentesis indicate acute gouty arthritis. Indomethacin is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug that can help relieve pain and inflammation in acute gout attacks. Probenecid and febuxostat are used to prevent future gout attacks, while colchicine is usually used in combination with other therapies for acute gout attacks.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of negatively birefringent crystals on polarized light in the joint fluid indicates gout. The best choice for treating pain associated with acute gouty arthritis is indomethacin. Probenecid is used for long-term prevention of gout attacks, colchicine is used for acute attacks if indomethacin is contraindicated or ineffective, and febuxostat is used for management of chronic gout.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms, including sudden onset of severe pain, ankle swelling, erythema, and warmth, suggests acute gout attack. Treatment for acute gout attacks includes nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) such as indomethacin. Probenecid helps reduce uric acid levels, while colchicine and febuxostat are used for prophylaxis of gout attacks, but not for acute attacks.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the ankle pain and arthrocentesis results suggest gout. Among the options, indomethacin is the preferred medication for treating acute gout attacks.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest acute gouty arthritis, and indomethacin is the drug of choice for treating acute gouty arthritis. Probenecid and febuxostat are used for chronic treatment of gout, while colchicine is used for prophylaxis or for acute attacks that do not respond to NSAIDs or corticosteroids.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of negatively birefringent crystals indicates gout as the cause of the patient’s pain. Among the options, indomethacin is the best choice for treating gout pain as it is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that inhibits prostaglandin synthesis by blocking the enzyme cyclooxygenase (COX). Probenecid and febuxostat are medications used for long-term prophylaxis of gout. Colchicine is used for acute gout attacks but can cause gastrointestinal side effects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of negatively birefringent crystals on polarized light and the sudden onset of symptoms suggests a gout attack. Indomethacin is an NSAID used to treat acute gout attacks. Probenecid is used for prophylaxis of gout attacks, colchicine can be used for acute gout attacks but is less effective than indomethacin, while febuxostat is used for chronic management of hyperuricemia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the arthrocentesis results suggest gout, and indomethacin is the drug of choice for acute gout attacks. Probenecid is used for chronic gout, colchicine can be used for acute gout attacks but is less effective than indomethacin, and febuxostat is used for chronic gout and is not effective for acute pain relief.
